verses.kjv: For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;
verses.ct: This Melchisedec was king of Salem and priest of the most high God. He met Abraham as Abraham was coming back from defeating the kings, and he blessed him.

verses.kjv: To whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;
verses.ct: Abraham gave him a 10th of everything he had gained. First, his name means "King of righteousness," and then he is also King of Salem, which means "King of peace."

verses.kjv: Without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.
verses.ct: There is no record of his father, mother, or genealogy, no record of when his life began or ended. He resembles the Son of God in this way, and he remains a priest permanently.

verses.kjv: Now consider how great this man was, unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.
verses.ct: Think about how significant this man was — even Abraham, the great patriarch, gave him a 10th of what he had captured.

verses.kjv: And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham:
verses.ct: Now, the descendants of Levi who serve as priests are required by the law to collect tithes from the people — that is, from their own brothers, even though they are all descended from Abraham.

verses.kjv: But he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.
verses.ct: But Melchisedec, who was not descended from Levi at all, collected a tithe from Abraham and pronounced a blessing on the one who had received God's promises.

verses.kjv: And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.
verses.ct: No one can dispute that the one who gives the blessing holds a higher position than the one who receives it.

verses.kjv: And here men that die receive tithes; but there he receiveth them, of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.
verses.ct: In the case of the Levitical priests, mortal men collect tithes. But in the case of Melchisedec, Scripture testifies that he lives on.

verses.kjv: And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.
verses.ct: In a sense, you could even say that Levi himself — the one whose descendants collect tithes — actually paid tithes through Abraham.

verses.kjv: For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.
verses.ct: Because Levi was still an unborn descendant of Abraham when Melchisedec met him.

verses.kjv: If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, (for under it the people received the law,) what further need was there that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron?
verses.ct: So if the Levitical priesthood could have brought people to spiritual completeness (since the law was built on that priesthood), why would there be any need for a different kind of priest — one in the order of Melchisedec rather than the order of Aaron?

verses.kjv: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.
verses.ct: When the priesthood is changed, the law that established it must necessarily change as well.

verses.kjv: For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar.
verses.ct: The one these things are referring to belongs to a completely different tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the altar.

verses.kjv: For it is evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.
verses.ct: It's clear that our Lord came from the tribe of Juda, and Moses never said anything about priests coming from that tribe.

verses.kjv: And it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest,
verses.ct: This becomes even more obvious when another priest appears who is like Melchisedec.

verses.kjv: Who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.
verses.ct: He did not become a priest based on a legal requirement about physical descent, but through the power of an indestructible life.

verses.kjv: For he testifieth, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
verses.ct: For Scripture declares about him, "You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchisedec."

verses.kjv: For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.
verses.ct: The earlier commandment is set aside because it was weak and ineffective.

verses.kjv: For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope did; by the which we draw nigh unto God.
verses.ct: The law never brought anything to completion. But now a better hope has been introduced, through which we can draw near to God.

verses.kjv: And inasmuch as not without an oath he was made priest:
verses.ct: Furthermore, this priesthood was established with an oath, which makes it even more significant.

verses.kjv: (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)
verses.ct: The Levitical priests were appointed without any oath, but this priest was appointed with an oath when God said to him, "The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind: You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchisedec."

verses.kjv: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.
verses.ct: Because of this oath, Jesus has become the guarantee of a far better covenant.

verses.kjv: And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:
verses.ct: Under the old system, there had to be many priests because death prevented any of them from continuing in their role.

verses.kjv: But this man, because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.
verses.ct: But because Jesus lives forever, his priesthood is permanent and never transfers to anyone else.

verses.kjv: Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.
verses.ct: That is why he is able to completely save those who come to God through him, since he lives forever to speak to God on their behalf.

verses.kjv: For such an high priest became us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;
verses.ct: This is exactly the kind of high priest we needed — one who is holy, innocent, pure, set apart from sinners, and elevated above the heavens.

verses.kjv: Who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins, and then for the people’s: for this he did once, when he offered up himself.
verses.ct: Unlike the other high priests, he doesn't need to offer sacrifices every day — first for his own sins and then for the sins of the people. He did this once and for all when he offered himself.

verses.kjv: For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law, maketh the Son, who is consecrated for evermore.
verses.ct: The law appoints as high priests men who are limited by weakness, but the oath that came after the law appoints the Son, who has been made perfect forever.
